alert.note: Alert for Assumption (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued April 07 at 2:58AM CDT until April 22 at 10:00PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM CDT THIS MORNING THROUGH 6 PM THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flash Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...Portions of southeast Louisiana and southern Mississippi, including the following areas and parishes, in southeast Louisiana, Assumption, Central Plaquemines, Central Tangipahoa, Eastern Ascension, Eastern Orleans, Lower Jefferson, Lower St. Bernard, Lower Tangipahoa, Northern Livingston, Northern St. Tammany, Southeast St. Tammany, Southern Livingston, Southwestern St. Tammany, St. Charles, St. James, St. John The Baptist, Upper Jefferson, Upper Lafourche, Upper Plaquemines, Upper St. Bernard, Upper Terrebonne, Western Ascension and Western Orleans. In southern Mississippi, Northern Hancock and Southern Hancock. * WHEN...From 6 AM CDT this morning through 6 PM CDT this evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations such as highly urbanized locations with poor drainage. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Heavy rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches with locally higher amounts possible. Greatest concern will be in poor drainage and urbanized areas. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
